text: What is a personal contract hire (PCH) agreement?
A personal contract hire (PCH) agreement involves you signing a contract to lease a car for a fixed period of time at an agreed monthly cost...
What is the difference between personal contract hire (PCH) and personal contract purchase (PCP)?
With both PCH and PCP agreements, the finance company owns the vehicle throughout the lease...
What is the difference between personal and business contract hire?
Business contract hire is popular with fleets and works like personal contract hire but for companies...
Is it a good idea to lease a new car?
Cars depreciate quickly. Leasing helps avoid value loss by turning depreciation into fixed payments...
Do you advertise ‘no deposit’ lease deals on Leasing.com?
We don’t advertise ‘no deposit’ lease deals, but some have a one-month initial rental...
What is the difference between an ‘in stock’ deal and a ‘factory’ order?
‘In stock’ means ready-to-go cars, while ‘factory’ orders need building and have longer delivery...
Is insurance included in a car lease deal?
No, insurance is not included in lease deals...
Can you get car insurance if you’re not the registered owner?
Yes. Lease cars are insured even if you're not the legal owner...
Can you lease a second car?
Yes, if you pass credit and affordability checks...
Is road tax included in a car lease?
Yes, it’s usually included for the lease duration or at least 12 months...
What happens if road tax increases during my lease contract?
You may be liable for any increases in Vehicle Excise Duty...
Is servicing and maintenance included in a car lease?
Some leases include maintenance. If not, you must service it yourself at approved centers...
What does initial rental mean?
It’s the upfront payment—e.g., 6 months of lease cost upfront...
Is there a mileage limit on a car lease?
Yes, all leases have mileage limits with excess charges...
Can I amend the agreed mileage part-way through a contract?
Yes, contact the leasing company to amend the mileage and monthly cost...
Can I lease a car if I have bad credit?
Yes, but credit checks apply and approval might be harder...
Who supplies the lease car?
Leasing.com advertises deals from UK brokers and dealers...
Is delivery and collection included in a lease deal?
Usually yes, delivery to mainland UK is included...
Can I part-exchange my existing car?
Leasing.com can’t buy your car, but can help sell it via Motorway...
What happens if a leased car windscreen cracks?
Check if your lease or insurance covers it. Otherwise, repair yourself...
What if the car gets damaged during the lease?
Minor damage is fine; major damage must be repaired before return...
What happens if my lease car is written off or stolen?
The insurer deals directly with the lease company. GAP insurance is recommended...
What lengths of contract are available?
Lease terms range from 12 to 60 months...
Can I put a personal number plate on the car?
Yes, with permission from the finance company...
Can I exit the lease deal early or transfer a lease to another person?
Early termination usually has fees. Transfers depend on the lease company...
What happens to your lease agreement if you die?
Termination penalties may still apply; the estate must settle them...
